data.title: Nicosia At a Glance
data.text:
Quick Facts and Everything You Need to Know About Nicosia, Cyprus. The city of Nicosia is an independent territory situated in Cyprus. Nicosia is the divided capital city of Cyprus. It gets a significant number of tourists annually for their local activities and historical landmarks. We’ve rounded up a few fun facts about the city of Nicosia that you ought to know!

History & Etymology

Named after Lefkosia, Nicosia has a rich background, from being founded in the 16th-century during the tail end of settlement civilizations to its institution into Cyprus in 1964 and its status today as an independent town. From the festivities and celebrations that the city regularly holds. Nicosia is home to a diverse community and complex culture and history to the fantastic local restaurants and bars both the natives and tourists enjoy.

Population Data and Figures on Geography

With a land area of 19.71 sq mi, Nicosia holds a significant populace of 200,452. The city of Nicosia is composed of a genuinely varied mix of people originating from all walks of life and backgrounds. And with NIC only a ways off from the centre of the city. It’s not surprising that Nicosia International Airport finds hundreds and thousands of people coming and going into Nicosia every day, whether for business or pleasure.

Culture and Popular Establishments

Coming from a detailed history as a city, Nicosia hosts some of the best restaurants and world-renowned hotels. Please take a look at our Top 5 lists of the city’s premier dining experiences and fanciest hotel rooms for when you’re in Nicosia. And while you’re here in the area, you might as well explore some of Nicosia’s most well-known landmarks. Make the most of your trip here, like The Cyprus Museum, Selimiye Camii, and Leventis Municipal Museum of Nicosia. Whether you’re an art aficionado, want to enjoy a lovely day out in the park, Nicosia has got the place for you!

Afterwards, suppose you would like to unwind and enjoy a chill night in. In that case, you can go to some of the city’s most notable bars and joints to get a bit of downtime and relaxation after a long day. If you time your vacation just right, you might even be able to catch one of our annual festivals and special events. If you’re a sports fan, you could even see a game or two at a local stadium. Whether you come here regularly for work or are visiting on holiday, we’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay in Nicosia.
